column4: how do i get the desktop cube to look like a cube? i have more than two workspaces
shawn:  double click on your ipod (it should open and show all files on it)
shawn:  that could be?  ive never worked with one that was synced with a mac
shawn:  try adding a different song (maybe that song is already on there ?)
shawn_selig:  try opening your ipod in rythmbox and pulling songs off of it
shawn_selig:  if that works you can pull them all of, sync it with a pc and then it should work in the way I described before
shawn_selig:  same sort of way I was describing before, open up rythmbox, double click on your ipod and then drag the songs to you music folder
i looked in the settings manager for compiz and couldnt find anything for number of sides
shawn:  wonderfull (that the exact way it *should* work to put them on after you format it with a pc)
shawn:  I do not know how to do that if you can!
shawn:  I would just find a windows computer, install itunes on it and sync with it(it will re-format it)
shawn:  yes that is the idea!
i tried increasing the number of desktops under general tab in compiz settings and still no cube
obviously you do if you increased them under general tab.  Ok then, make sure you have cube selected and rotate cube
should i logout and then back in
under system->preferences->apperance->visual effects do you have custom selected
